climbs.name: Her Swollen Belly Sail Swept the Sea

content.description: Follows gully/cracks to stance where original route's bolt ladder heads right. Ascend Â steeper, looser, face (hooking-bolts) to hollow flakes/cracks & cracks formed by huge detached blocks to col. From here traverse to fissure climbing to top of grassy ledges where Challenger's chimney tops out, then slabs up.
content.protection: bolts, hooks, and pro up to a yellow Tri-Cam
content.location: from the base of the west face, pass huge block leaning against the wall to ledge/cave, continue on exposed slabs to surmount stacked monster blocks to loose gully- follow it up to base of "water-smoothed" gully with flaring crack on right

climbs.name: Challenger Chimney
climbs.fa: Harvy Carter, Don Liska, Mike Cohen, 1968

content.description: Gully north of the tower, rotten crack, hollow flake, 30 ft bolt ladder, 150 ft chimney with "no protection available," & difficult slab to top.
content.location: Get over to the east side of Spinnaker, and scramble up gully and left facing dihedral.4 rappels- 1st to col, then down gully.

content.description: A hulk of a peak, this tower has a broad summit area with lower angled slabs at the top; its adjoining spire, Bollard, is at its base, and is one of a number of wide buttresses / pillars that have their accompanying deep chimney counterpart; these thin out higher up the formation. Spinnaker's north face has some formidable lines; its east side is also quite featured and shares its col with the basalt ridge line, which rims the Black Bowl, leads north, then west, & ends with the spire across the Black Gully from Spinnaker: Crow.
